posts.post_content:
Posted By: Jeff Schwarz
Please help me finish several sets that my father started as a youth.  I have many items for trade or will buy outright.  VG is fine.  Dad was not very condition conscious.  He is 89 now and would get a kick out of getting anything on our list.  As you know, it is tough finding the last few that you need.  I thought this board could help us out.  Thanks for looking!

B18 - Dee Walsh, Browns, red basepaths
E98 - Wagner, Cobb, Jennings, Bender, Lajoie, Brown, Collins, Young, Vaughn, Bridwell, Mack, Meyers, Mullin, Dooin, Davis, Chance
E120 - American Caramel, Series of 80, too many to mention
PCC765-1-1 Dietsche 1907 Cobb - fielding
PCC775 Grignon - Chance, Sheckard, Steinfeldt, Taylor
Orbit Gum Pins (unnumbered) - Cissell, Earnshaw, Stephenson
R309-2 - Bell, Greenberg, Cleveland Team
R311-1 Glossy - National League Champions 1935
R315 - Haas
R324 - 1941 Goudey - Warstler, Crouch
R332 Schutter Johnson - Cuyler
R335 - 1940 Playball - Lazzeri
W517 - Kelly Brooklyn
W461 - 1923-24 Exhibits - Bottomley, Burns, Flagstead, Gonzales, Groh, High, Holke, McGraw, Piercy, Pipp, Ruth, Sand, Sewell, Simmons, S. Smith, Veach
W461 - 1925 Exhibits - Alexander, Benton, Bottomley, Cobb, Decatur, Gehrig, Grimes, Harper, Henline, E. Smith, Terry, F. Williams
W461 - 1926 Exhibits - too many to mention, but please let me know what you have
W461 - 1927 Exhibits - Gehrig
W463-2 - 1931-32 Exhibits (upper left corner) - Comorosky, Flowers, Root, Klein, Lary, Maranville, Richbourg, Roettger, Waner
W463-3 - 1933 Exhibits (upper left corner) - Berry, Cochrane, Fitzsimmons, Lopez, MacFayden, Richbourg, Stephensen
1925-31 Exhibits (Set 81-83) - Pipp, Scott, Smith, Wheat and silhouette backgrounds for Faber, Gehrig, Hartnett, Sisler, Speaker, Waner, Wilson 


Thanks again!

edit for items picked up through Board members and at the National.

Posted By: Jeff Schwarz
bump and thanks to all that have corresponded thus far.
